revised_title: Infra-Red Spectra of Synthetic Polypeptides and their Configurations
tldr: The authors examined the infra-red spectra of various synthetic polypeptides to determine how the frequencies and relative intensities of the amide bands are affected by the side-chain size and nature. They found that the C=0 stretching mode frequency is a good indicator of the polypeptide chain configuration, with optically active forms having a range of 1652-1657 cm⁻¹ and meso forms having a slightly higher range of 1661-1665 cm⁻¹. The study also showed that the effect of absorbed water on the spectra of some polypeptides is mainly additive.
